heatmap_age¶

vizcovidfr.heatmaps.heatmap.heatmap_age(start, end=None, granularity='France', num_reg=1, frequency='daily')¶

Make a heatmap by age class and the given frequency for incidence rate.

Parameters

  • start (str) –

    if frequency=’daily’:

    if end=None, must be a year and a month on the format ‘YYYY-MM’ else, must be a day on the format ‘YYYY-MM-DD’

    if frequency=’weekly’:

    must be the week of a year on the format ‘YYYY-SWW’, and end is not optional and must be of the same format

  • end (NoneType or str, optional only if frequency='daily' and if start is of the format 'YYYY-MM') – date when the heatmap stops. Only if start is on format ‘YYYY-MM-DD’ or ‘YYYY-SWW’. Must be on format ‘YYYY-MM-DD’ or ‘YYYY-SWW’, same than start. Must be a date later than start.

  • granularity (str, optional, default='France') – the granularity we want the heatmap to be based on. Should be either ‘region’ or ‘France’.

  • num_reg (int, optional (useful only if granularity='region'), default=Guadeloupe) – code of the region you want to display. Codes are the official INSAA code region and are given in the dictionary below.

Region dictionary :

1 : Guadeloupe

2 : Martinique

3 : Guyane

4 : La Reunion

6 : Mayotte

11 : Île-de-France

24 : Centre-Val de Loire

27 : Bourgogne-Franche-Comte

28 : Normandie

32 : Hauts-de-France

44 : Grand Est

52 : Pays de la Loire

53 : Bretagne

75 : Nouvelle-Aquitaine

76 : Occitanie

84 : Auvergne-Rhône-Alpes

93 : Provence-Alpes Côte d’Azur

94 : Corse

Parameters

frequency (str, optional, default='daily') – the time frequency to show on the heatmap should be ‘weekly’ or ‘daily’

Returns

A heatmap with two axis: one for age and one for day

Return type

seaborn heatmap

Example

Heatmap for the month of March 2021 in France

>>> heatmap_age(start='2021-03')

Heatmap between 2021-03-12 and 2021-04-10 in France

>>> heatmap_age(start='2021-03-12', end='2021-04-10')

Heatmap between week 3 and week 10 of the year 2021 in France

>>> heatmap_age(start='2021-S03', end='2021-S10', frequency='weekly')

Heatmap for the month of March 2021 in Martinique

>>> heatmap_age(start='2021-03', granularity='region', num_reg=2)

heatmap_reg_age¶

vizcovidfr.heatmaps.heatmap.heatmap_reg_age(date)¶

Make the heatmap for one given date between regions and age ranges for incidence rate.

Parameters

date (str) – a day on the format ‘YYYY-MM-DD’ or a week on the format ‘YYYY-SWW’

Returns

A heatmap with two axis: one for age range and one for region

Return type

seaborn heatmap

Example

>>> heatmap_reg_age("2020-S35")

heatmap_reg_day¶

vizcovidfr.heatmaps.heatmap.heatmap_reg_day(age, start, end=None, frequency='jour')¶

Make the heatmap for one given age range between regions and date interval for incidence rate.

Parameters

  • start (str) –

    if frequency=’daily’:

    if end=None, must be a year and a month on the format ‘YYYY-MM’ else, must be a day on the format ‘YYYY-MM-DD’

    if frequency=’weekly’:

    must be the week of a year on the format ‘YYYY-SWW’, and end is not optional and must be of the same format

  • end (NoneType or str, optional only if frequency='daily' and if start is of the format 'YYYY-MM') – date when the heatmap stops. Only if start is on format ‘YYYY-MM-DD’ or ‘YYYY-SWW’. Must be on format ‘YYYY-MM-DD’ or ‘YYYY-SWW’, same than start. Must be a date later than start.

  • age (int) – integer in the following list: 0: all ages 9: from 0 to 9 years old 19: from 10 to 19 years old 29: from 20 to 29 years old 39: from 30 to 39 years old 49: from 40 to 49 years old 59: from 50 to 59 years old 69: from 60 to 69 years old 79: from 70 to 79 years old 89: 80 or older

  • frequency (str, optional, default='daily') – the time frequency to show on the heatmap should be ‘weekly’ or ‘daily’

Returns

A heatmap with two axis: one for time and one for regions

Return type

seaborn heatmap

Examples

Heatmap between week 36 and week 52 of the year 2020 for all ages

>>> heatmap_reg_day(0, "2020-S36", "2020-S52", "week")
